metadata.Title: CVE-2021-30663 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An integer overflow was addressed with improved input validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 14.5.1 and iPadOS 14.5.1, tvOS 14.6, iOS 12.5.3, Safari 14.1.1, macOS Big Sur 11.3.1. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-30663` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.32.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.32.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.32.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.32.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.32.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.32.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.32.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
webkit2gtk package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.32.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
